rev.comment: future events should be always treated as uncertain

Firefox 8 will be 20% faster than Firefox 5, indicated by testing on several metrics, placing it on par with the performance of Google Chrome 14.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.extremetech.com/internet/89570-firefox-8-is-20-faster-than-firefox-5-matches-chrome-14 |title=Firefox 8 is 20% faster than Firefox 5, matches Chrome 14 |publisher=ExtremeTech |date=2011-07-11 |accessdate=2011-08-17}}</ref>
+
Firefox 8 is expected to be 20% faster than Firefox 5, indicated by testing on several metrics, placing it on par with the performance of Google Chrome 14.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.extremetech.com/internet/89570-firefox-8-is-20-faster-than-firefox-5-matches-chrome-14 |title=Firefox 8 is 20% faster than Firefox 5, matches Chrome 14 |publisher=ExtremeTech |date=2011-07-11 |accessdate=2011-08-17}}</ref>
It is currently in the "Beta" release channel (see ''Development'' section, below)<!-- , and the beta test versions can be downloaded from their [http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/all-aurora.html Aurora] site in various languages. -->, and the second alpha test version can be downloaded from their [http://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/all-aurora.html Aurora] site in various languages.<!-- Update once the Mozilla web site has been updated. The channel is correct (see https://wiki.mozilla.org/Releases), but builds are not available. -->
